direction.raw_text: : A progression of images of CELESTE and JESSE, ages 18 to 30. Visual media evolves with them throughout the years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A1 Celeste is a chronic overachiever and Jesse is sweet, goofy and funny. He makes her laugh. They are best friends but it's clear that Jesse wishes they were more. Close-up of their hands crossed, making "C" and "J" shapes. Celeste and her football player boyfriend, Mike, kissing. Jesse watches enviously from the sidelines, holding Mike's helmet.

result.heading: A1 POLAROIDS OF HIGH SCHOOL MOMENTS

direction.raw_text: : B1 They go to college together, study together, drink together. They are still best friends. Junior year, Celeste with Saleem, her hot, black militant boyfriend. They kiss passionately. A moment later, Jesse poses reluctantly with the couple, holding up a "Black Power" fist, weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : C1 Senior year, Jesse draws "C AND J FOREVER" in a pristine, snowy forest with a stick; he and Celeste laugh. A moment later, they kiss deeply. They are finally together.

direction.raw_text: : D1 On an engraved necklace, carved into a tree, written on a wet beach, and on their wedding cake.

direction.raw_text: . PAUL IS TELLING A STORY-HE IS ANIMATED AND CONFIDENT. CELESTE LOOKS AT HIM, SLIGHTLY EMBARRASSED. A MOMENT LATER, BETH AND TUCKER ERUPT IN LAUGHTER. CELESTE SMILES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JESSE OFFERS VERONICA HIS HAND.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TARGET-AFTERNOON 99 Celeste is shopping for a dresser. She is talking to a salesperson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, it comes with directions and it's actually really easy to assemble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you do not know me. I do not want to assemble. Trust me, you do not want me to assemble. Bad things happen. Could I just take the floor model? I'll hook you up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme go ask my manager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, dude. Celeste is browsing and spots Veronica with a shopping cart filled with baby stuff. She approaches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) Veronica? Hey, Celeste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, yeah, hi! What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm getting a dresser. You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you know getting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CELESTE Baby stuff. Baby stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) Beth is uh...throwing me a baby shower? So I have to register.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is? Celeste swallows this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) That's uh...really nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very. And so helpful right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. (laughs nervously) Well, looks like you're really organized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Organized, terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll do great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. I hope so. They share an awkward moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) Listen, I never got a chance to just tell you I'm so sorry about all this. Trust me, I didn't expect...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't. Really. There's nothing to apologize for. I'm the one who's sorry. I mean, I dug through your trash. Celeste laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I don't blame you. For anything. This has all been so weird. Everything happened really fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it did. But everything will work out. I know it. Jesse's book is coming out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's so talented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he is. An awkward silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) Well, good luck. Nice to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too. They both steer their carts towards each other in opposite directions but bump right into each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sorry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's okay! Bye again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROSEN KARAOKE-KOREATOWN- LATER THAT NIGHT 100 Celeste and Paul are in a private karaoke room. Paul is belting his heart out, singing Boyz II Men, "On Bended Knee." Celeste is loving it. She has her own mike and pipes in once in a while with a harmony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can somebody tell me how to get things back the way they used to be...oh God give me a reason, I'm down on bended knee..ooohohhh ooooh
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooohh ohhh. Til you come back to me..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm down on bended knee hee hee hee. They finish with a huge applause for themselves and toast with beers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) I think we're really good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we ARE really good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Celeste punches in the numbers for the next song. It's "Islands in the Stream," made popular by Kenny Rogers and Dolly Parton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get ready. You're first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby when I met you, there was peace on earth, I set out get you with a fine tooth comb. I was soft inside. Soft inside? What the fuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh come on. Focus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do something to me, that I can't explain, hold me closer, and I feel no pain. Tender love is blind, it requires a dedication. Celeste and Paul sing in harmony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honest love, we feel, needs Honest love, we feel, needs conversation. And we ride it conversation. And we ride it it together, uh huh... it together, uh huh... Celeste slowly drops her mike. Paul is still singing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Come on, we're so good together. Islands in the stream, that is what we are. Get in there!! This is my favorite part!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I'm pitchy but I'm finding it. Sail away with me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. This. Us. I'm sorry. Paul slowly drops his mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just...can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you serious? Oh no. Why? He sits down on the couch. The music is still playing in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I need to be alone? I'm not ready. I'm having fun and I feel like I'm beginning to like you and I just don't think I'm ready for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Really? Celeste doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) Wow, you're breaking my heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry. You are so...great. But I'm getting divorced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Celeste, I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I need to go through this alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Yeah, okay. I respect that. Live by will, not by force.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're only ready when you're ready, you know? Don't force it. It's just some yoga shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I do like you. I like you a lot. And when you are ready, if you're ready, call me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STEIN, WEINBERG, STEINBERG & JIMENEZ LAW FIRM - 101 AFTERNOON Celeste and Jesse sit across from each other with their respective lawyers. They are both dressed very well. The atmosphere is formal, tense. There is not a lot of talking but there is a lot of loud paper shuffling and ball point pens. CELESTE'S LAWYER, male, 40, speaks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sign here. And here. And here. Celeste looks up, makes eye contact with Jesse and smiles uncomfortably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) And here. Here. Yup. Aaaaaand here. Here. Couple more. Here... Celeste is still signing. She looks at Jesse again, who is straightening his tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like that tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it made out of organic mung beans? Jesse nods and chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I actually found it digging through your trash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohhh, I see. All right. They've broken the tension. But it's still silent. Then Jesse chortles. It sounds like a baby pig. It makes Celeste laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Now, both Celeste and Jesse are silently cracking up, doubled over as their lawyers sit there, watching them, perplexed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STEIN, WEINBERG, STEINBERG & JIMENEZ LAW FIRM - 102 A LITTLE LATER Celeste and Jesse walk out of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...we're divorced! They high five. What are you supposed to do when you get divorced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna walk for a couple minutes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LACMA- SUNDOWN 103 Celeste and Jesse are now approaching the front of "Urban Light," the installation from the beginning of the movie. The street lamps are now illuminated. She takes a seat on a step. Jesse sits next to her. She refers to the lamps:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you hated them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, I've never seen them at night. Jesse looks at the lamps and takes them in. He looks pretty sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) What's up with you? I know we just got divorced but no one died, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just feeling like maybe you were right. I am a fuck up. I don't know what I'm doing. My girlfriend left. There is a long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Veronica? Left where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Left me. She wanted me to tell her everything was gonna be okay and I couldn't. I don't know why but I just...couldn't. She wants to go back to Brussels. Another monumental pause. Jesse's eyes start tearing up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) Okay, you can say it now. You were right, I blew it. Just say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey...don't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are not a loser. You never were. You took a chance. I admire that and I believe in you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. And I want to thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For never being the person I wanted you to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you're welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go get her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I don't know if everything is gonna be all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, who does? Do you love her? Jesse looks at Celeste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it's worth fighting for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Okay. Celeste smiles with tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I finally understand why you fucking cry all the time. Shit is emotional. They share a laugh. Then, they sit in silence for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) You deserve to be happy. And I wish that for you, always.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...I guess we were right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Celeste makes the "C and J" hand gesture from the high school photo in the opening montage. Jesse makes it back. They smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTD) I love you. He kisses her on the lips. For the last time. And then, he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Celeste sits awhile and looks up at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CELESTE'S PRIUS- NEXT DAY 104 Celeste drives and dials a number on her bluetooth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. So, you're probably giving your card to some girl in yoga right now. But if that doesn't work out for you...I think I may be ready. To beat you in Scrabble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GAS STATION- A MOMENT LATER 105 Celeste runs in to pay for gas. She is on her Blackberry.
direction.name: direction
